creditline: Gift of Elizabeth, Julie, and Catherine Andrus in memory of John and Marion Andrus
description: reclining nude woman lying on side with her back to viewer, looking toward ground; a boy stands behind the woman, resting his hand on her head, looking toward similar point on the ground; another nude figure crawls on all fours at L; foliage and castle in background
marks:
Signature, Title, Stamps

in graphite on verso:  monogram in plate, upper left: [HSB]; title in pla
provenance: Paul Davidsohn, Danzig, sale 1920; Theodor Apel (1884-1949), Ermlitz; John E. Andrus III, Wayzata, Minn.; by descent to his daughters, Elizabeth, Katie, and Julie. Earlier provenances have been gathered, but further research will increase our knowledge of their histories.
title: Penance of St. John Chrysostomus
